meanings.definition: A large French country house or castle.
meanings.sent1: The chateaux in the countryside were beautifully decorated with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: We visited many chateaux during our vacation in France.
meanings.sent3: The chateaux had so many rooms that even the ghosts got lost!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a grand chateaux filled with memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The chateaux stood proudly on the hill, a symbol of elegance and history.

meanings.sent1: The tour guide pointed out the chateaux as we drove past them.
meanings.sent2: The map highlighted all the chateaux we planned to visit.
meanings.sent3: The chateaux looked like a row of giant gingerbread houses.
meanings.sent4: In her dreams, the chateaux floated in the sky like fluffy clouds.
meanings.sent5: The chateaux sparkled in the sunlight, a sight to behold for all travelers.
